wikipedia_page.main: John Perie VC (1831 – 17 September 1874) was a Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: * John Perie (1831–1874) VC, born in Huntly.

link_mentions.page: List of Scottish Victoria Cross recipients

response: On 18 June 1855 in the Crimea, Lieutenant Graham, accompanied by a sapper (John Perie) showed determined gallantry at the head of a ladder party at the assault on the Redan at Sebastopol. He also went out on numerous occasions to bring in wounded officers and men.
*John Perie (1831–1874), Scottish soldier and Victoria Cross recipient
